SEARCH
Module com.example.rubankfx
Package com.example.rubankfx

Class Date

java.lang.Object
com.example.rubankfx.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
The Date class represents a valid date object. It provides functionality to check the validity of a date, compare it to other dates, and convert it to a string for representation. This class is immutable once created.
Author:
Digvijay Singh, Arun Felix

    • makeDate

      public static Date makeDate(String input)
      Static function which creates the Date object.
      Parameters:
      input - String containing date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
      Returns:

    • isValid

      public Boolean isValid()
      Checks if the date is valid and meets the specific conditions: 1. It is a future date or the current date. 2. The age of all account holders must be above 16. 3. The day and month combination is valid.
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid according to the mentioned conditions, false otherwise. If the date is not valid, it prints an error message

    • getLastMessage

      public String getLastMessage()

    • checkCollegeCheckingValidity

      public boolean checkCollegeCheckingValidity()
      Checks if the date (representing a date of birth) is valid for a College Checking account. The criteria for validity is based on an age range of 16 to 24, inclusive.
      Returns:
      true if the age derived from the date is between 16 to 24, inclusive; false otherwise.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares the specified object with this date for equality. Return true if and only if the specified object is also a date and both dates represent the same year, month, and day.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - object to be compared for equality with this date.
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this date, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date o)
      Compares two date instances;
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      o - Date we can to compare
      Returns:
      negative number if this date is less than o, positive if greatetr, 0 if equal.

    • toString

      public String toString()

      public static void main(String[] args)
